sample_id: 647Describe the life cycle of a robot

source_paragraph: The life cycle of a plant begins with a seed. The seed then sprouts, forming a root. The root helps to stabilize the plant and provides it with water and nutrients. The pollen is then used to fertilize other plants and complete the life cycle.
target_paragraph: A robot's life cycle begins when its microchip is powered up. The microchip then sends signals to the motor, which is responsible for powering the robot's movement. Finally, the robot's activities are monitored and adjustments are made accordingly.

target_paragraph: Climate change has a direct impact on people, as it alters their lifestyles and affects their livelihoods. source_paragraph: The internal combustion engine is powered by a fuel-air mixture that is ignited by a spark plug.  The spark plug creates a spark that ignites the combustible gases, which then expands and forces the piston downwards.  The combustion of the fuel-air mixture creates thermal energy, which is then used to drive the piston back up and turn the crankshaft.  The ignition of the fuel-air mixture and subsequent compression of the combustible gases are key elements of the internal combustion engine.

source_paragraph: A solar eclipse occurs when the sun and the moon line up in such a way that the sun blocks the light from the moon. The moon then passes its shadow onto the Earth, causing a portion of the Earth to experience darkness. As the moon continues in its orbit, the shadow passes and the Earth is illuminated again.
target_paragraph: The immune system responds to an infection by releasing antibodies that bind to the invading pathogens and block them from entering the body. Macrophages are also released to patrol the body and remove any debris or pathogens. Additionally, lymphocytes are sent to fight off the foreign invaders. All of these processes work together to protect the body from infection.

The vaccine is then administered to the patient, allowing the body to develop the necessary antibodies to protect against the antigens.

sample_id: 649Describe the life cycle of a human being

source_paragraph: The life cycle of a plant begins with a seed, which germinates in the soil and grows into a stem. The stem produces leaves, which are used to gather sunlight for photosynthesis. As the plant continues to mature, a flower blooms with colorful petals. When the flower is pollinated, the plant produces fruit, which ripens and contains seeds. These seeds are then released and the cycle begins again.
target_paragraph: A human life begins as a fetus gestating in the uterus. As a child, the individual develops motor and cognitive skills. As an adult, he or she often obtains qualifications and starts a career. Finally, the elderly person passes on their knowledge and experiences to the next generation.

The winds in a hurricane can reach speeds of over 160 mph, and they move the clouds associated with the storm towards the center.
target_paragraph: A nuclear reactor works by using nuclear fuel to produce energy. This energy is generated by a fission reaction that creates heat. target_paragraph: Ideas propagate through minds and over time, individuals develop a shared environment that anchors their identity and culture. source_paragraph: The liver is an important organ in the body that helps to filter toxins and waste out of the bloodstream. The kidneys work in conjunction with the liver to filter out waste and toxins. The glomerulus of the kidneys absorb nutrients from the bloodstream and secretes them into the urine, which is then stored in the bladder. The liver then helps to process the nutrients, toxins, and waste found in the urine to further cleanse the body.
target_paragraph: Enzymes are proteins that catalyze biochemical reactions in the cell. They act as catalysts by increasing the rate of reactions without being used up in the process. In order for the enzyme to work, it needs to be activated with a cofactor. The cofactor binds to the enzyme, causing a conformational change that allows the substrate to bind. The enzyme then catalyzes the reaction between the substrate and cofactor and the products are released from the cell.

The exchange of heat and moisture helps the cooling tower to produce cooled air that can be used to cool other systems.

target_paragraph: A virus replicates itself by entering a host cell. Once inside, it uses the host cell's machinery to produce more of itself. source_paragraph: The internal combustion engine works by using the spark plug to ignite the fuel-air mixture contained in the combustion chamber. The piston then compresses the gas, creating a high-pressure environment. The spark plug is triggered again, causing the fuel-air mixture to combust and expand, pushing the piston down. The exhaust valve then releases the exhaust gases, allowing the piston to return to its original position and repeat the cycle.
target_paragraph: The human heart functions when an electrical impulse triggers the contraction of the heart muscle.  This contraction pumps the blood throughout the body. The oxygen is then pumped out to the rest of the body.

target_paragraph: Viruses can be transmitted through contagion, which occurs when an infected person comes into contact with another person. source_paragraph: In mitosis, chromosomes in the cell replicate and separate into two identical sets. The process starts with the breakdown of the nuclear membrane during interphase. During metaphase, the chromosomes are aligned in the center of the cell. After anaphase, the daughter cells move toward opposite poles of the cell. The cytoplasm then divides and the daughter cells separate.
target_paragraph: The human immune response begins when antigens stimulate the production of antibodies. source_paragraph: A nuclear power plant works by using a nuclear reactor. The reactor produces energy when uranium undergoes fission, which splits the atoms and releases energy. target_paragraph: Immunity is the body's ability to protect itself from foreign substances. When a pathogen enters the body, the immune system works to recognize and respond to it. relations: (spore, germinates, mycelium) like (idea, spreads, people). (gills, produce, spores) like (individuals, share, beliefs). (mushroom, matures, cap) like (society, develops, culture)
source_paragraph: The life cycle of a mushroom starts with a spore. When the spore germinates, it becomes a mycelium. The mycelium grows and develops into a mushroom with a cap. On the underside of the cap, there are gills that produce spores and release them into the environment. As the mushroom matures, the cap expands and the spores are released. This completes the life cycle of a mushroom.
target_paragraph: The spread of an idea among people can be the catalyst for the growth of a society.  Individuals within this society share beliefs, values and customs, and this in turn develops a unique culture.  The culture is constructed through the collective knowledge and experiences of members of the society.  It is through this process that a society can grow and develop.

source_paragraph: The pancreas is a gland that plays a vital role in digestion and metabolism. It produces insulin, which helps regulate blood sugar levels, and secretes enzymes that help break down food. Insulin helps the body absorb and use glucose, which is the main source of energy for cells. The enzymes secreted by the pancreas help break down proteins, carbohydrates, and fats. The pancreas also works to regulate the amount of glucose in the blood, ensuring it remains at the right level.
target_paragraph: The stock market is a mechanism that produces wealth by creating investment opportunities and regulating financial risk. It is an efficient way to invest capital in the hopes of generating returns. By buying and selling shares in publicly traded companies, investors are able to make money off of the price movements of these stocks. Additionally, the stock market regulates financial risk by helping to ensure that investors are aware of the potential risks associated with their investments.

The process of photosynthesis occurs when light energy is converted to chemical energy by plants.

source_paragraph: Making a cake is a simple and enjoyable process. To begin, mix together the flour and eggs. Once combined, add other ingredients such as butter, sugar, and milk. Mix all of the ingredients together until the batter is smooth and creamy. Once the batter is ready, pour it into a greased cake tin and bake it in the oven. Once it is finished baking, the cake can be decorated with icing and other decorations of your choice. Enjoy!
target_paragraph: Constructing a model of a molecule involves bonding atoms together to form molecules. For example, sugar molecules are held together by the bonding of atoms. When sugar is placed in water, the molecules dissolve due to their weaker bonds, allowing the sugar to dissolve in the water.

sample_id: 652Describe the life cycle of a drone
source_subject: Describe the life cycle of a rabbit
target_subject: Describe the life cycle of a drone
relations: (rabbit, reproduces, offspring) like (drone, manufactures, components). (rabbit, consumes, food) like (drone, consumes, fuel). (rabbit, grows, fur) like (drone, builds, wings)
source_paragraph: A rabbit's life cycle begins with the reproductive process. A female rabbit reproduces and gives birth to offspring. The baby rabbits then consume food and grow fur. As they mature, they become capable of reproducing and the cycle repeats itself.
target_paragraph: The life cycle of a drone begins with its manufacture, where components such as motors, sensors, and electronic components are assembled. Once the drone is complete, it is ready to consume fuel and build its wings. The drone is then ready to take off and perform its mission. Once the mission is complete, the drone begins to consume fuel again and returns to its starting point. Finally, the drone dismantles itself and its components are recycled, completing its life cycle.

sample_id: 517How does a mechanical system of water pump works?
source_subject: Describe the life cycle of a frog
target_subject: How does a mechanical system of water pump works?
relations: (egg, develops into, tadpole) like (inlet, transforms into, outlet). (adult frog, releases, eggs) like (pump, releases, water). (tadpole, grows into, adult frog) like (water, moves through, impeller)
source_paragraph: The life cycle of a frog begins with an egg, which develops into a tadpole. The tadpole has a tail and gills which it uses to live in water. As it grows, it develops legs and lungs, and eventually transforms into an adult frog. The adult frog then releases eggs, which begins the cycle anew. The tadpole will grow into an adult frog, and the cycle will repeat.
target_paragraph: The inlet of the water pump transforms the liquid into the outlet. The water pump releases the water from the inlet and pushes it through the impeller. The impeller rotates and its blades create a pressure that moves the water through the system. The pressure created by the pump causes the water to be discharged from the outlet at a higher pressure than the inlet.

sample_id: 522Describe the life cycle of an aircraft
source_subject: Describe the life cycle of a bird
target_subject: Describe the life cycle of an aircraft
relations: (egg, hatches, chick) like (fuselage, assembles, aircraft). (flapping, propels, wings) like (thrust, propels, engines). (nest, provides, shelter) like (hangar, provides, protection)
source_paragraph: The life cycle of a bird begins with an egg, which hatches into a chick. The chick will learn to flap its wings, which propels it through the air. The bird will build a nest, which provides shelter and a place to lay eggs. The nest will be used to raise the chicks until they are ready to leave the nest and begin their own life cycle.
target_paragraph: The fuselage is the main body of the aircraft and it is assembled from different components and parts. Engines provide the thrust to propel the aircraft and they are mounted on the wings and/or fuselage. Once the aircraft is in the air, the pilot controls its path and altitude. When the aircraft needs to land, it is steered towards the hangar which provides protection from the elements.
